text: The Saudi Professional League () is the main football competition in Saudi Arabia. The first competition was held in the 1976–77 season. == List of teams (2024–25 season) == {| class="wikitable" Club Position in 2024/25 Al-Ahli, Jeddah 8th Al-Qadsiah, Khobar 5th Al-Fateh, Al-Hasa 18th Al-Hilal, Riyadh 1st Al-Ittihad, Jeddah 2nd Al-Khaleej, Saihat 6th Al-Nassr, Riyadh 3rd Al-Orobah, Al-Jawf 13th Al-Raed, Buraydah 11th Al Shabab, Riyadh 4th Al-Riyadh, Riyadh 9th Al-Taawon, Buraydah 7th Damac, Khamis Mushait 10th Al-Ettifaq, Dammam 12th Al-Okhdood Club, Najran 14th Al-Kholood, Ar Rass 15th Al-Fayha, Al Majma'ah 16th Al-Wehda, Mecca 17th ==Performance by club== ===Most successful clubs=== No. Club Winners Runners-up Winning Years 1 Al-Hilal 13 13 1977, 1979, 1985, 1986, 1988, 1990, 1996, 1998, 2002, 2005, 2008, 2010, 2011 2 Al-Nassr 9 5 1976, 1980, 1981, 1989, 1994, 1995, 2014, 2015, 2019 3 Al-Ittihad 5 7 1982, 1997, 1999, 2000, 2001, 2003, 2007, 2009 4 Al-Shabab 6 5 1991, 1992, 1993, 2004, 2006, 2012 5 Al-Ahli 2 6 1978, 1984 6 Al-Ettifaq 2 2 1983, 1987 7 Al- Fateh 1 0 2013 ====Total titles won by town or city==== Town or city Number of titles Clubs Riyadh 25 Al-Hilal (13), Al-Nassr (9), Al-Shabab (6) Jeddah 10 Al-Ittihad (8), Al-Ahli (2) Dammam 2 Al-Ettifaq (2) Al-Hasa 1 Al-Fateh (1) == References == == Other websites == * Saudi Arabia Football Federation at FIFA.com Arabic - English Site * Saudi Arabia Professional League on Super.com Arabic Site Category:Football leagues in Asia
